description: From French ptérion, from ptère (“wing of the sphenoid bone”), from Ancient Greek πτερόν (pterón, “wing”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The point corresponding with the posterior end of the sphenoparietal suture; known as the weakest part of the skull.
examples: Then standing before a closet mirror, he put the automatic to his head, at the point of the pterion, and pressed the comfortably concaved trigger.
